block.p: Diane Wichard, the advertising director of Allure magazine, and Michael Silberstein, the managing director of the Holiday Inn Crowne Plaza Hotel in New York, were married last evening in Greenwich, Conn. Rabbi Robert Lennick officiated at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Baraf.

Mrs. Silberstein, 35 years old, graduated from the Laboratory Institute of Merchandising. She is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Tvrdik of Orlando, Fla. Her father was the director of communications for the New York Metropolitan Transit Authority before his retirement.

Diane Wichard, the advertising director of Allure magazine, and Michael Silberstein, the managing director of the Holiday Inn Crowne Plaza Hotel in New York, were married last evening in Greenwich, Conn. Rabbi Robert Lennick officiated at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Baraf.

Mrs. Silberstein, 35 years old, graduated from the Laboratory Institute of Merchandising. She is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Tvrdik of Orlando, Fla. Her father was the director of communications for the New York Metropolitan Transit Authority before his retirement.

Mr. Silberstein, 45, graduated from the Cornell University School of Hotel Administration. He is a son of Paul Silberstein of Tel Aviv, a retired manager of the Dan Hotel, and the late Dinah Silberstein. The bridegroom's first marriage ended in divorce, as did the bride's.
